definition: variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]

sentences.english: A punky band is prodding uproar.
sentences.chinese: 一個朋克樂隊是慫恿一片譁然。

sentences.english: The scandal titillated the whole country.
The results again lead to a public outcry sparked strong indignation of the general public.
sentences.chinese: 結果再次導致輿論譁然，引發廣大民衆之強烈憤慨。

sentences.english: Here's proof that anything funny-looking in the sky can cause an uproar.
sentences.chinese: 可以證明，天空中任何有趣式樣都可以引起一片譁然。
